intro: Torilis nodosa f. longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-stemmed hedge parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated peduncles that bear clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. The inflorescence is often tall and showy, making it a notable presence in its native habitat.
